intro: Helicophyllum hastatum, commonly known as the spiral-leaved helicophyllum, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is known for its finely divided, feathery foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Helicophyllum hastatum is primarily found in parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in shaded, woodland areas.
